newsitem.title: RUSSIA: TsUM closer to ADR issue with SEC exemption.
newsitem.headline: TsUM closer to ADR issue with SEC exemption.

text.p: has been exempted from information disclosure under U.S. Securities Exchange Commission (SEC) rule 12g3-2(b), TsUM's financial consultants OLMA said on Wednesday.
Exemption from this rule is a prerequisite for companies wishing to issue level-one American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) on their shares.
ADRs are share look-alikes which allow stock in foreign companies to be traded on U.S. markets and which ease custody and settlement problems common in developing and emerging markets.
The SEC must conduct a thorough review of a company's accounts before granting permission for an ADR issue.
Level-one ADR issues are backed by existing company shares and do not raise any new capital or involve any issues of new shares.
Many Russian companies have issued or announced plans to issue ADRs. Shares of Russian companies which announce plans to issue ADRs generally outperform the market in the short-term.
The Moscow city government is OAO Torgovy Dom TsUM's main shareholder, with about 16 percent of the company's shares.
